data.stimulus:
TASK 2: LOGICAL ORDER

Now you have added the descriptions to each section of a typical report, can you put the sections in their usual order. This order should help the reader to see the logical development of your writing.

list: TOPIC SENTENCE - You present the idea that will be discussed in the paragraph
SUPPORTING SENTENCE(S) - You give further relevant information about the topic
ANALYSIS - You cite and analyse different pieces of research connected to the key idea of the paragraph, showing connections and discrepancies and interpreting the significance of these
CONCLUDING SENTENCE - You summarise the overall findings of this paragraph. These should clearly link to your overall purpose and should logically link to the next paragraph.
data.stimulus:
TASK 3: STRUCTURE OF A DISCUSSION PARAGRAPH

Paragraph structure can vary, depending on which section of the report they appear in. Below we will look at the structure of a typical discussion paragraph. Put the different elements into the correct order to create a logical paragraph structure. Can you see any similarities between the structure of a discussion paragraph, and the overall structure of a report?

TASK 4: TECHNIQUES FOR MAKING LOGIC CLEAR IN YOUR WRITING

In a coherent piece of writing, the reader can clearly follow your argument. They are helped by the way you order your information and ideas in each section and eacg paragraph. As they read, each part of your writing builds on the one before. You set out a clear plan for your reader at the start, you develop ideas, as laid out in your plan, and at the end, you make it clear to the reader what they have learnt. 

Cohesive techniques help us to achieve this goal. They are the tools that we use in our writing to make sure that links and the progression of our argument are clear to our reader. 

The general rule for clear writing? Make life easy for the reader! Don't make them struggle to follow your argument. Use COHERENCE and COHESION to guide them!
